newsitem.title: DUBAI: Total completes first Iranian oil well - paper.
newsitem.headline: Total completes first Iranian oil well - paper.

text.p: France's Total SA has completed drilling its first well at the Sirri oil and gas fields offshore Iran, the London-based Arabic newspaper al-Hayat reported on Tuesday.

Al-Hayat quoted Total's director of Middle East affairs Christophe Dumarjorie in Paris as saying that production at Sirri would begin in early 1998 at 20,000 barrels per day (bpd) and would eventually rise to 120,000 bpd.
Total signed a groundbreaking $600 million deal with the National Iranian Oil Company (NIOC) in July 1995 to develop the Sirri E and A fields.
Total began drilling delineation wells at the Sirri E structure in June, according to Iranian oil officials.
Malaysian state oil firm Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas) has acquired a 30 percent stake in the Sirri project.

U.S. President Bill Clinton on August 5 signed the Iran-Libya Sanctions Act that calls for sanctions to be imposed on non-U.S. firms that invest $40 million or more annually in the Iranian or Libyan energy sectors.
Total officials have said that the White House bill will not affect its Sirri investment.
